newsitem.title: USA: Heating oil costs may top outlook last week - US EIA.
newsitem.headline: Heating oil costs may top outlook last week - US EIA.

text.p: U.S consumers may face higher heating oil costs this winter than the Energy Information Administration projected last week, EIA administrator Jay Hakes said Tuesday.
"From a consumer's standpoint, last week's price outlook might be a little optimistic," Hakes said at a natural gas industry luncheon.
Since then, he said European heating oil prices have continued to firm, giving U.S. refiners greater incentive to export heating oil to Europe and less incentive to build domestic inventories.
